column4: hi all, I was wondering about how java is handeled in ubuntu...apparently, its nicer now ?
nicer how?
they call gcj java
thats not nice
but you can use suns and run update-alternatvies iirc
no kidding
ubuntu comes with gcj
is it easy to uninstall gcj and install sun's instead ?
pretty easy , one sec ill get you a link
http://wiki.serios.net/wiki/Ubuntu_Java_JRE/JDK_installation or apt-get install sun-java5-jdk sun-java5-plugin sun-java5-fonts
you can get it from sun
but know , the amd64 jvm doesnt have webstart :\
indeed
not sure , doing it by hand is not too hard
i can download an rpm from sun
dont get the rpm
read that link i gave you
it tells you how step by step
are you going to be here in an hour or so? Im downloading the liveCD and seeing how java and stuff fairs with it
i will be heading home about then :\
but you can always find me in ##swing or ##java
